posts.post_content: I bought this card several years ago when ISA first started. The card measures out, as a matter of fact, it is a tad over the standard T206 length measurements.  SGC looked at this card at the National and thought it looked looked good, but has to be cracked out to grade. I have heard the horror stories on cracked out cards, so is it better off graded ISA 8, or cracking out and risking a skeptical grader? I have compared this card to dozens of my other T206s and the card stacks up. A PSA 8 would go for $25K+ range (there's only 2 PSA 8's, none higher, and only 5 PSA 7's). Asking $4500 delivered..
Beautiful card Kevin. Good luck with the sale.
Thanks for the inquiries, Elberfeld is available..
I will start at 150. In that holder you will not get much more if you even get that.
Dude crack and get it re-graded.  The risk is worth the reward.

[quote name="ajjohnsonsoxfan" post=1695449]Dude crack and get it re-graded.  The risk is worth the reward.[/QUOTE]

This.

[quote name="Bigb13" post=1630263]I will start at 150. In that holder you will not get much more if you even get that.[/QUOTE]

And here I had forgotten all this drama....    :rolleyes:
I like this card, but could you give a ballpark of what price youre looking for?
Thanks for the inquiries, price has been added....
